entry: Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa (COMESA)
description: note - formerly known as Preferential Trade Area for Eastern and Southern Africa (PTA) treaty signed 5 November 1993; treaty ratified 8 December 1994 recognizing, promoting and protecting fundamental human rights, commitment to the principles of liberty and rule of law, maintaining peace and stability through the promotion and strengthening of good neighborliness, commitment to peaceful settlement of disputes among member states members - (19) Burundi, Comoros, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Egypt, Eritrea, Eswatini, Ethiopia, Kenya, Libya, Madagascar, Malawi, Mauritius, Rwanda, Seychelles, Sudan, Uganda, Zambia, Zimbabwe
